headline: Banks’ Wall Street Businesses Boom as Executives See Staying Power
summary: Morgan Stanley and Bank of America on Wednesday reported third-quarter financial results that blew past investors’ expectations, thanks in part to their dealmakers’ and traders’ fortunes.  Mergers and acquisitions and initial public offerings are picking up, leading to busier times for bankers who underwrite deals, arrange financing, and advise management teams on transactions.  A volatile market, meanwhile, has led to a fresh wave of activity on trading desks across Wall Street.

headline: How AI could power a new age of Big Bank profitability
summary: As Big Banks kick off their earnings season this week, Hennessy Funds portfolio manager David Ellison joins Market Catalysts to discuss the financial sector. Watch the video above to hear Ellison's thoughts on how AI could help Big Banks break out of their historic profitability range. Read up on Yahoo Finance's analysis of earnings figures out from Morgan Stanley (MS) and Bank of America (BAC). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Morgan Stanley Wealth Unit Shines in Buoyant Stock Market
summary: The bull market is doing wonders for the wealth management industry as clients put more money in their accounts and conduct more trades.  The company is one of the nation’s largest wealth managers, with thousands of financial advisors and self-directed brokerage E*Trade.  Total client assets for the wealth management unit in the third quarter rose 18% year over year to $7.05 trillion.

headline: Dow Futures Rise as Fed Rate Cut Bets Build
summary: The Morning Bull - US Market Morning Update Wednesday, Oct, 15 2025 US stock futures are pointing higher this morning as investors digest falling Treasury yields and fresh signals that the Federal Reserve may be ready to cut rates. Optimism is being tempered by concerns over the pace of job growth and renewed US-China trade tensions. This combination leaves the market on edge as policymakers weigh the risks of a cooling economy and persistent geopolitical uncertainty. Investors are watching...

headline: WFC Q3 Deep Dive: Asset Cap Removal Fuels Loan Growth and Strategic Investments
summary: Financial services giant Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC) reported revenue ahead of Wall Street’s expectations in Q3 CY2025, with sales up 5.3% year on year to $21.44 billion. Its GAAP profit of $1.66 per share was 7.4% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Wells Fargo (WFC) Margin Gains Reinforce Bullish Narrative Despite Slower Growth Outlook
summary: Wells Fargo (WFC) delivered 17.7% earnings growth over the past year, outpacing its robust 15.4% annualized growth rate of the last five years. Net profit margins improved to 25.3% from 21.8% a year ago, capping off a strong set of results that highlight high quality past earnings even as growth forecasts now trail the broader US market. Revenue is expected to grow at 5.5% per year and earnings at 3.8% per year according to forecasts, both notably below the anticipated 10% and 15.5% per year...
